ROC passports without National ID numbers are not accepted unless the holder has permanent residency in another country.

China.desc: ROC passports are not recognized for entry and transit. However, all ROC nationals with Household Registration are also able to apply for a Mainland Travel Permit for Taiwan Residents either before arrival or on arrival, allowing the holder to enter and stay in Mainland China until its expiry. All ROC nationals can also apply for a Chinese Travel Document before arrival which allows them to remain for up to 2 years. Issuance of the Taiwan Compatriot Permit or Chinese Travel Document is not automatic for all ROC nationals and is at the sole discretion of the PRC government.

Thailand.desc: 30 days (maximum two visits annually if not arriving by air)

Tunisia.desc: 4 months; ID card valid in certain cases

Turkey.desc: 3 months ; ID card valid Former Turkish citizens with aTurkish "Blue Card" (Mavi Kart): Freedom of movement.

Turkmenistan.desc: Pre-approved visa can be picked up on arrival.

United Kingdom.desc: Freedom of movement; ID card valid

United States.desc: 90 days on arrival from overseas; ESTA (valid for 2 years when issued) required if arriving by air or cruise ship.

Uzbekistan.desc: Pre-approved visa can be picked up on arrival. Simplified procedure for German citizens.

Vietnam.desc: 15 days; effective from 1 July 2015 - 30 June 2017. A single entry eVisa valid for 30 days is also available.

Zambia.desc: 90 days; also eligible for a universal visa allowing access to Zimbabwe.

Zimbabwe.desc: 3 months; also eligible for a universal visa allowing access to Zambia.

Albania.desc: Holders of valid multiple entry visa issued by the United States/United Kingdom/Schengen States are exempt

Argentina.desc: E-Visa if holding a valid US or Schengen visa. Multiple entry and 90 days per stay.

Armenia.desc: Also visa free for 30 days for diplomatic passports and passports for public affairs.

Azerbaijan.desc: 30 days; available at airports eVisa is also available.

Barbados.desc: Visa exempt for cruise passengers arriving and departing on the same vessel and passengers who are in transit from the airport and cruise terminal (or vice versa). Mutual waiver agreement signed and is yet to be ratified.

Belarus.desc: Visa-free for 5 days for holders a Schengen visa or a national visa of country of EU, must arrive via Minsk International Airport.Visa free when traveling as part of an accredited tourist group. Group leaders must hold the original of the invitation letter issued by an accredited travel agency and a list of visitors verified by Chinese national (CNTA), provincial, municipal authority responsible for tourism.

Belize.desc: Cruise passengers do not require a visa.

Benin.desc: Visa free for 90 days if travel on duty.

Bolivia.desc: Visa free for passports for public affairs.

Bosnia and Herzegovina.desc: Visa free for passports for public affairs. Visa free for a maximum stay of 7 days for valid visa holders and residents of the European Union member states.

Bulgaria.desc: Visa free for if holding a valid Schengen visa (single or multiple entry.

Cambodia.desc: 30 days on arrival, or e-visa online

Canada.desc: No transit visa required if transiting Toronto Pearson Terminal 1 or Vancouver International Airports to or from the USA on same travel day (no overnight stay) while holding valid USA visa and travelling on selected airlines. Visa not required for permanent residents of the USA. eTA is still required by permanent residents of USA if traveling by air.

Chile.desc: Visa free for holders of valid visa for Canada or the US, valid for a minimum of 6 months from the arrival date.

Colombia.desc: Visa free for holders of valid visa for Schengen area or the US, valid for a minimum of 180 days from the arrival date. .

Republic of the Congo.desc: Visa free for passports for public affairs.

Costa Rica.desc: Visa free for a maximum stay of 30 days for holders of passport for public affairs.Visa free for holders of valid visa for Canada or the US.

Côte d'Ivoire.desc: 3 months; eVisa holders must arrive via Port Bouet Airport.

Croatia.desc: Visa exempt for holders of a visa issued by a Schengen Member State and a travel health insurance. Passenger must travel as a tourist in an organised group and arrive from a Schengen Member State.

Cuba.desc: Tourist Card can be purchased for a maximum stay for 30 days.

Dominican Republic.desc: Holders of a visa issued by Canada, USA or any European Union member state will be issued a Tourist Card for a stay of max. 30 days. max 90 days for UK resident.

Egypt.desc: According to Egyptian diplomatic missions in China, Chinese citizens can apply for visa on arrival since July 19, 2016 and can stay for up 30 days. However, according to IATA, Chinese citizens are visa exempt for 30 days if they hold a return ticket, a reservation in a 4 or 5 star hotel, and USD 2000.

Gabon.desc: Electronic visa holders must arrive via Libreville International Airport.

Guyana.desc: Visa free for 3 months, for passports for public affairs.

Honduras.desc: Visa free for holders of a visa valid for at least 6 months issued by Canada, the USA, or a Schengen Member State, and for residents of the UK, Japan, Singapore, Australia and New Zealand.

Hungary.desc: Hungary was a hotspot for illegal Chinese immigrants between 1990 and 1992, because after the collapse of the communist bloc, it was the only major European country that granted visa free entry for Chinese citizens. Hungary abolished it in 1992 after the massive number of illegal immigrants (50,000 at its highest).

India.desc: 60 days; eTV holders must arrive via 16 designated airports.

Ireland.desc: Visa waiver for UK 'C' visa holders until October 2016 or for holders of British visas endorsed with BIVS. Entry permitted only if first point of entry to the Common Travel Area is in the UK.

Japan.desc: Passengers of approved cruiseships do not require a visa from April 2015.

North Korea.desc: Chinese tourists may visit Tongnim County without a visa for 2 days. They may also visit Sinuiju for a day trip without a visa.

South Korea.desc: Visa free for visits to Jeju Island for up to 30 days. Individual "transit tourists" bound for or arriving from one of the following countries and holding a valid visa or re-entry permit for that country: EEA member state, Switzerland, USA, Japan, Canada, Australia, or New Zealand. Must show a confirmed flight ticket for onward departure from Korea within 30 days. If traveling by air to Jeju Island via Seoul, Busan, Cheongju, Muan and Yangyang, Chinese citizens traveling as part of a tourist group by authorized travel agent may stay in mainland South Korea for up to 15 days.

Kuwait.desc: Visa free for 30 days for passports for public affairs.

Lebanon.desc: 1 month extendable for 2 additional months; granted free of charge at Beirut International Airport or any other port of entry if there is no Israeli visa or seal, holding a telephone number, an address in Lebanon, and a non refundable return or circle trip ticket.

Macedonia.desc: Visa exempted for 15 days if holding a double or multiple Schengen C visa or a visa issued by USA, Canada or United Kingdom. The visa must be valid for at least 5 days beyond the period of intended stay in Macedonia. Visa free for a maximum stay of 90 days for holders of passports for public affairs.

Malaysia.desc: Between March 1, 2016 to December 31, 2017, Chinese citizens do not require a visa for Malaysia for a stay of up to 15 days, online registration prior to arrival required

Mexico.desc: Visa free for holders of valid visas issued by Canada, Japan, United Kingdom, United States, or a Schengen member state. Also visa free for all visiting "through maritime ports as passengers in tourism cruises"

Montenegro.desc: Visa free for a maximum stay of 30 days for valid visa holders and residents of the European Union member states and the United States.

Myanmar.desc: 28 days. eVisa holders must arrive via Yangon, Nay Pyi Taw or Mandalay airports. Visa on arrival is available for any countries foreigners if departing from Guangzhou by Myanmar Airways.

Nepal.desc: Visa is issued free of charge for tourists.

New Zealand.desc: Visa free if having a current Australian permanent residence visa or a current Australian resident return visa. eVisa eligible if "you are outside New Zealand and are from a visa waiver country or from China and are applying for a student, visitor or work visa"..

Pakistan.desc: Visa on arrival when travelling on business valid for 30 days. Conditions apply. Visa on arrival when travelling as part of a group through a designated tour operator.

Panama.desc: Visa exempted for a max. stay of 30 days for holders of a valid visa for Andorra, Australia, Canada, Iceland, Monaco, Liechtenstein, Norway, San Marino, Switzerland, USA, 30 days for UK permanent residents.

Peru.desc: Visa free if holding valid US/Canada/UK/Australia/Schengen visa (at least 6 months before expiry) or permanent residency in US/CA/UK/EU/AU countries. Up to 180 days per stay for tourism and business.

Philippines.desc: Visa-free 7 days if a tourist and holding a valid visa for Schengen countries, Australia, Canada, Japan or the USA.

Romania.desc: Visa free if holding valid Schengen multiple entry visa. The journey has to be completed before the expiration of Schengen visa.

Russia.desc: Visa free for a maximum stay of 15 days for visitors travelling as part of a tour group (5 to 50 persons), accompanied by a representative of a tour operator accredited in both Russia and China. Visa free for 30 days for diplomatic and service passports since April 26, 2014.

Saint Lucia.desc: Cruise ship passengers visiting for one day are visa exempt

San Marino.desc: 90 days. Although no visa is required, travelers must transit through Italy to reach San Marino, which requires at least a single entry Schengen visa.

São Tomé and Príncipe.desc: 30 days. Holders of a visa issued by the United States or a Schengen area member state do not require a visa for stays up to 15 days.

Serbia.desc: 30 daysVisa free for a maximum stay of 90 days for holders of a passport for public affairs.Visa free for a maximum stay of 90 days for valid visa holders and residents of the European Union member states and the United States.

Singapore.desc: Visa free for 30 days for holders of passport for public affairs.

Somalia.desc: Visa may be obtained on arrival, provided an invitation letter by the sponsor had been submitted to the authorities before arrival.

Suriname.desc: 90 days; available at Johan Adolf Pengel International Airport.

Tajikistan.desc: 45 days; Visa free for passports for public affairs. Visa also available online. E-visa holders can enter through all border points.

Ukraine.desc: 15 days for business or tourist purposes, available at Boryspil International Airport and Odessa International Airport.

United Kingdom.desc: Visa not required if holding a valid Irish visa endorsed with BIVS. Entry permitted only if first point of entry to the Common Travel Area is in Ireland.

United States.desc: Chinese citizens who do receive a visa are normally issued "120-month multiple-entry combination B1/B2 visas."

Venezuela.desc: Visa free for 30 days, for diplomatic, service passports and passports for public affairs. (since January 8, 2014)

Vietnam.desc: Visa free for 30 days, for passports for public affairs.Visa on arrival can be arranged online through travel agencies and are available at Ho Chi Minh City, Hanoi and Da Nang airports.A single entry eVisa valid for 30 days is also available (not apply to Chinese e-passport holders)

Zimbabwe.desc: Approved tour groups may obtain visa on arrival.
